title: Paytm, PhonePe, Google Pay vs. cash: India’s long journey to a digital economy
text:
The Indian government has been pushing for a cashless economy, but only a fourth of country’s half a billion mobile-Internet users opt for digital payments. Though cashless transactions are seeing brisk growth, notes in circulation, and the usage of cheques continue to remain high. Further, despite cashbacks and other attractive offers, the popularity of digital payments is still largely limited to urban areas.
